keywords.doc:
Attaches a running application by process id.

sut_id is the application process id.

Example:

Attach Application By Id 12188
keywords.name: Attach Application By Id
keywords.shortdoc: Attaches a running application by process id.

keywords.doc:
Attaches a running application by name.

sut_name is the name of the process.

Example:

Attach Application By Name UIAutomationTest
keywords.name: Attach Application By Name
keywords.shortdoc: Attaches a running application by name.

keywords.doc:
Attaches WhiteLibrary to a window.

locator is the locator of the window or a window object.

Window locator syntax

Syntax for a window locator is prefix:value.

When the locator syntax is used, the window is searched from the currently attached application. See Attach Application By Id, Attach Application By Name or Launch application for more details about attaching an application.

The following window locators are available:

Prefix Description
title (or no prefix) Search by the exact window title. If no prefix is given, the window is searched by title by default.
id Search by AutomationID.
class_name Search by class name.

Examples:

Attach Window Main Window # attach window with title
Attach Window id:mainWindow # attach window with Automation ID
Attach Window class_name:NavigationWindow # attach window with ClassName

Window objects

A window can also be attached by directly passing the window object as the locator parameter value. This may be useful if the correct window cannot be found by using the window locator syntax.

Example:

@{windows} Get Application Windows
Attach Window ${windows[1]} # attach window at index 1 in window list

When using a window object as the locator parameter value, the window is attached even if it does not belong to the currently attached application. Note that when attaching a window that belongs to a different application than the currently attached one, attaching the window does not affect what application is attached to the library.
keywords.name: Attach Window
keywords.shortdoc: Attaches WhiteLibrary to a window.

keywords.doc:
Verifies exact text in a button.

locator is the locator of the button or Button item object. Locator syntax is explained in Item locators.

expected_text is the expected button text.

case_sensitive defines if the text comparison is case sensitive (True/False). Defaults to True. Boolean values are evaluated in the same way as the Robot Framework BuiltIn library does, see the documentation of BuiltIn for details.
keywords.name: Button Text Should Be
keywords.shortdoc: Verifies exact text in a button.

keywords.doc:
Verifies expected text is found in a button.

locator is the locator of the button or Button item object. Locator syntax is explained in Item locators.

expected_text is the expected button text.

case_sensitive defines if the text comparison is case sensitive (True/False). Defaults to True. Boolean values are evaluated in the same way as the Robot Framework BuiltIn library does, see the documentation of BuiltIn for details.
keywords.name: Button Text Should Contain
keywords.shortdoc: Verifies expected text is found in a button.

keywords.doc:
Clicks a button.

locator is the locator of the button or Button item object. Locator syntax is explained in Item locators.

Optional arguments x_offset and y_offset can be used to define the coordinates to click at, relative to the center of the item.
keywords.name: Click Button
keywords.shortdoc: Clicks a button.

keywords.doc:
Clicks an item.

locator is the locator of the item or object of an item. Locator syntax is explained in Item locators.

Optional arguments x_offset and y_offset can be used to define the coordinates to click at, relative to the center of the item.
keywords.name: Click Item
keywords.shortdoc: Clicks an item.

keywords.doc:
Clicks an item in the currently open popup/context menu.

text_path is the path to the item to click.

Examples:

Click Popup Menu Item Paste # click an item in the root level
Click Popup Menu Item Refactor Rename # click a sub item
keywords.name: Click Item In Popup Menu
keywords.shortdoc: Clicks an item in the currently open popup/context menu.

keywords.doc:
Clicks a menu button.

locator is the locator of the menu button or Menu item object. Locator syntax is explained in Item locators.

Optional arguments x_offset and y_offset can be used to define the coordinates to click at, relative to the center of the item.
keywords.name: Click Menu Button
keywords.shortdoc: Clicks a menu button.

keywords.doc:
Clicks a button in a toolstrip (toolbar).

locator is the locator of the toolstrip.

index is the zero-based index of the toolstrip button to click.
keywords.name: Click Toolstrip Button By Index
keywords.shortdoc: Clicks a button in a toolstrip (toolbar).

keywords.doc: Closes the attached application.
keywords.name: Close Application
keywords.shortdoc: Closes the attached application.

keywords.doc:
Closes a window.

locator is the locator of the window or a window object (optional).

If no locator value is given, the currently attached window is closed. See Attach Window for details about window locators and attaching a window.
keywords.name: Close Window
keywords.shortdoc: Closes a window.

keywords.doc:
Verifies that a combobox contains an item with text expected.

Fails if the combobox does not contain an item with the given text.

locator is the locator of the combobox or ComboBox item object. Locator syntax is explained in Item locators.

expected is the expected item text.
keywords.name: Combobox Should Contain
keywords.shortdoc: Verifies that a combobox contains an item with text ``expected``.

keywords.doc:
Verifies that a combobox does not contain an item with text expected.

Fails if the combobox contains an item with the given text.

locator is the locator of the combobox or ComboBox item object. Locator syntax is explained in Item locators.

expected is the expected item text.
keywords.name: Combobox Should Not Contain
keywords.shortdoc: Verifies that a combobox does not contain an item with text ``expected``.

keywords.doc:
Double clicks an item.

locator is the locator of the item or object of an item. Locator syntax is explained in Item locators.

Optional arguments x_offset and y_offset can be used to define the coordinates to click at, relative to the center of the item.
keywords.name: Double Click Item
keywords.shortdoc: Double clicks an item.

keywords.doc:
Double clicks a listview cell.

locator is the locator of the listview or ListView item object. Locator syntax is explained in Item locators.

column_name is the name of the column.

row_index is the zero-based row index.

Optional arguments x_offset and y_offset can be used to define the coordinates to click at, relative to the center of the item.

Example:

Double Click Listview Cell id:addressList Street 0 # double click cell in the column "Street" of the first row
keywords.name: Double Click Listview Cell
keywords.shortdoc: Double clicks a listview cell.

keywords.doc:
Double clicks a listview cell at index.

locator is the locator of the listview or ListView item object. Locator syntax is explained in Item locators.

row_index is the zero-based row index.

column_index is the zero-based column index.

Optional arguments x_offset and y_offset can be used to define the coordinates to click at, relative to the center of the item.

Example:

Double Click Listview Cell By Index id:addressList 0 0
keywords.name: Double Click Listview Cell By Index
keywords.shortdoc: Double clicks a listview cell at index.

keywords.doc:
Double clicks a listview row.

locator is the locator of the listview or ListView item object. Locator syntax is explained in Item locators.

column_name and cell_text define the row. Row is the first matching row where text in column column_name is cell_text.

Optional arguments x_offset and y_offset can be used to define the coordinates to click at, relative to the center of the item.

Example:

Double Click Listview Row id:addressList City Helsinki # double click row that has the text "Helsinki" in the column "City"
keywords.name: Double Click Listview Row
keywords.shortdoc: Double clicks a listview row.

keywords.doc:
Double clicks a listview row at index.

locator is the locator of the listview or ListView item object. Locator syntax is explained in Item locators.

row_index is the zero-based row index.

Optional arguments x_offset and y_offset can be used to define the coordinates to click at, relative to the center of the item.

Example:

Double Click Listview Row By Index id:addressList 4
keywords.name: Double Click Listview Row By Index
keywords.shortdoc: Double clicks a listview row at index.

keywords.doc:
Double-clicks a tree node.

locator is the locator of the tree or Tree item object. Locator syntax is explained in Item locators.

node_path is the path the to node to double-click.

See examples of the node path in Select Tree Node documentation.
keywords.name: Double Click Tree Node
keywords.shortdoc: Double-clicks a tree node.

keywords.doc:
Drags item with locator locator1 to item with locator locator2.

locator1 is the locator of the draggable object or draggable item.

locator2 is the locator of the target for the draggable object or target item itself.

Locator syntax is explained in Item locators.
keywords.name: Drag And Drop
keywords.shortdoc: Drags item with locator ``locator1`` to item with locator ``locator2``.

keywords.doc:
Expands a tree node.

locator is the locator of the tree or Tree item object. Locator syntax is explained in Item locators.

node_path is the path the to node to expand.

See examples of the node path in Select Tree Node documentation.
keywords.name: Expand Tree Node
keywords.shortdoc: Expands a tree node.

keywords.doc:
Returns a list of windows belonging to the currently attached application.

Assumes that an application is attached. See Attach Application By Name and Attach Application By Id for details.
keywords.name: Get Application Windows
keywords.shortdoc: Returns a list of windows belonging to the currently attached application.

keywords.doc:
Returns the state of a check box.

Returns True if the check box is selected, False if not.

locator is the locator of the check box or CheckBox item object. Locator syntax is explained in Item locators.
keywords.name: Get Check Box State
keywords.shortdoc: Returns the state of a check box.

keywords.doc: Returns a list of windows on the desktop.
keywords.name: Get Desktop Windows
keywords.shortdoc: Returns a list of windows on the desktop.

keywords.doc:
Returns the first item that matches the given locator.

locator is the locator of the item. Locator syntax is explained in Item locators.
keywords.name: Get Item
keywords.shortdoc: Returns the first item that matches the given locator.

keywords.doc:
Returns a list of items that match the given locator.

Locator syntax is explained in Item locators.
keywords.name: Get Items
keywords.shortdoc: Returns a list of items that match the given ``locator``.

keywords.doc:
Returns text of a listview cell.

See Double Click Listview Cell for details about arguments locator, column_name, and row_index.
keywords.name: Get Listview Cell Text
keywords.shortdoc: Returns text of a listview cell.

keywords.doc:
Returns text of a listview cell at index.

See Double Click Listview Cell By Index for details about arguments locator, row_index, and column_index.
keywords.name: Get Listview Cell Text By Index
keywords.shortdoc: Returns text of a listview cell at index.

keywords.doc:
Returns a list containing text of each cell in a listview row.

See Double Click Listview Row for details about the arguments locator, column_name, and cell_text.
keywords.name: Get Listview Row Text
keywords.shortdoc: Returns a list containing text of each cell in a listview row.

keywords.doc:
Returns text of a listview row as a list.

See Double Click Listview Row By Index for details about arguments locator and row_index.
keywords.name: Get Listview Row Text By Index
keywords.shortdoc: Returns text of a listview row as a list.

keywords.doc:
Returns mouse position as tuple (x, y).

Position is relative to application window top left. If mouse is outside the application window the return values is either negative or bigger than window dimensions.

Example:

${x} ${y} Get Mouse Location
keywords.name: Get Mouse Location
keywords.shortdoc: Returns mouse position as tuple (x, y).

keywords.doc:

locator is the locator of the progress bar or ProgressBar item object. Locator syntax is explained in Item locators.
keywords.name: Get Progressbar Value

keywords.doc:
Returns the state of a radio button.

Returns True if the radio button is selected, False if not.

locator is the locator of the radio button or RadioButton item object. Locator syntax is explained in Item locators.
keywords.name: Get Radio Button State
keywords.shortdoc: Returns the state of a radio button.

keywords.doc:
Returns the value of a slider.

locator is the locator of the slider or Slider item object. Locator syntax is explained in Item locators.
keywords.name: Get Slider Value

keywords.doc:
Gets all tab pages and returns them as a list.

locator is the locator of the tab control item or Tab item object. Locator syntax is explained in Item locators.
keywords.name: Get Tab Pages
keywords.shortdoc: Gets all tab pages and returns them as a list.

keywords.doc:
Returns the text of a label.

locator is the locator of the label or Label item object. Locator syntax is explained in Item locators.
keywords.name: Get Text From Label
keywords.shortdoc: Returns the text of a label.

keywords.doc:
Returns the text of a text box.

locator is the locator of the text box or Textbox item object. Locator syntax is explained in Item locators.
keywords.name: Get Text From Textbox
keywords.shortdoc: Returns the text of a text box.

keywords.doc:
Returns BusyTimeout value of White.

See also Set White Busy Timeout.
keywords.name: Get White Busy Timeout
keywords.shortdoc: Returns BusyTimeout value of White.

keywords.doc:
Returns DoubleClickInterval value of White.

See also Set White Double Click Interval.
keywords.name: Get White Double Click Interval
keywords.shortdoc: Returns DoubleClickInterval value of White.

keywords.doc:
Returns DragStepCount value of White.

See also Set White Drag Step Count.
keywords.name: Get White Drag Step Count
keywords.shortdoc: Returns DragStepCount value of White.

keywords.doc:
Returns FindWindowTimeout value of White.

See also Set White Find Window Timeout.
keywords.name: Get White Find Window Timeout
keywords.shortdoc: Returns FindWindowTimeout value of White.

keywords.doc:
Returns title of the currently attached window.

Assumes that a window is attached. See Attach Window for details.
keywords.name: Get Window Title
keywords.shortdoc: Returns title of the currently attached window.

keywords.doc:
Hold down a special key.

key must be one of the accepted special keys, see documentation of Press Special Key
keywords.name: Hold Special Key
keywords.shortdoc: Hold down a special key.

keywords.doc:
Writes text to a textbox.

locator is the locator of the text box or Textbox item object. Locator syntax is explained in Item locators.

input_value is the text to write.
keywords.name: Input Text To Textbox
keywords.shortdoc: Writes text to a textbox.

keywords.doc:
Verifies that an item is disabled.

locator is the locator of the item. Locator syntax is explained in Item locators.
keywords.name: Item Should Be Disabled
keywords.shortdoc: Verifies that an item is disabled.

keywords.doc:
Verifies that an item is enabled.

locator is the locator of the item. Locator syntax is explained in Item locators.
keywords.name: Item Should Be Enabled
keywords.shortdoc: Verifies that an item is enabled.

keywords.doc:
Launches an application.

sut_path is the absolute path to the application to launch.

args is a string of arguments to use when starting the application (optional).

Examples:

Launch Application C:/path/to/MyApp.exe # Launch without arguments
Launch Application C:/path/to/MyApp.exe /o log.txt # Launch with arguments
keywords.name: Launch Application
keywords.shortdoc: Launches an application.

keywords.doc:
Leave a special key that was previously held down.

key must be one of the accepted special keys, see documentation of Press Special Key
keywords.name: Leave Special Key
keywords.shortdoc: Leave a special key that was previously held down.

keywords.doc:
Checks the listbox selection.

Fails if the selection was not as expected.

locator is the locator of the listbox or ListBox item object. Locator syntax is explained in Item locators.

expected is the expected selection value.
keywords.name: Listbox Selection Should Be
keywords.shortdoc: Checks the listbox selection.

keywords.doc:
Checks that listbox contains an item with text expected.

Fails if the listbox does not contain an item with the given text.

locator is the locator of the listbox or ListBox item object. Locator syntax is explained in Item locators.

expected is the expected item text.
keywords.name: Listbox Should Contain
keywords.shortdoc: Checks that listbox contains an item with text ``expected``.

keywords.doc:
Verifies that a listbox does not contain an item with text expected.

Fails if the listbox contains an item with the given text.

locator is the locator of the listbox or ListBox item object. Locator syntax is explained in Item locators.

expected is the expected item text.
keywords.name: Listbox Should Not Contain
keywords.shortdoc: Verifies that a listbox does not contain an item with text ``expected``.

keywords.doc:
Verifies that the given listview cell contains text expected.

See Double Click Listview Cell By Index for details about arguments locator, row_index, and column_index.
keywords.name: Listview Cell At Index Should Contain
keywords.shortdoc: Verifies that the given listview cell contains text ``expected``.

keywords.doc:
Verifies that the given listview cell does not contain text expected.

See Double Click Listview Cell By Index for details about arguments locator, row_index, and column_index.
keywords.name: Listview Cell At Index Should Not Contain
keywords.shortdoc: Verifies that the given listview cell does not contain text ``expected``.

keywords.doc:
Verifies that the given listview cell contains text expected.

See Double Click Listview Cell for details about arguments locator, column_name, and row_index.
keywords.name: Listview Cell Should Contain
keywords.shortdoc: Verifies that the given listview cell contains text ``expected``.

keywords.doc:
Verifies that the given listview cell does not contain text expected.

See Double Click Listview Cell for details about arguments locator, column_name, and row_index.
keywords.name: Listview Cell Should Not Contain
keywords.shortdoc: Verifies that the given listview cell does not contain text ``expected``.

keywords.doc:
Verifies that listview cell text is expected.

See Double Click Listview Cell By Index for details about arguments locator, row_index, and column_index.
keywords.name: Listview Cell Text At Index Should Be
keywords.shortdoc: Verifies that listview cell text is ``expected``.

keywords.doc:
Verifies that listview cell text is not expected.

See Double Click Listview Cell By Index for details about arguments locator, row_index, and column_index.
keywords.name: Listview Cell Text At Index Should Not Be
keywords.shortdoc: Verifies that listview cell text is not ``expected``.

keywords.doc:
Verifies that listview cell text is expected.

See Double Click Listview Cell for details about arguments locator, column_name, and row_index.
keywords.name: Listview Cell Text Should Be
keywords.shortdoc: Verifies that listview cell text is ``expected``.

keywords.doc:
Verifies that listview cell text is not expected.

See Double Click Listview Cell for details about arguments locator, column_name, and row_index.
keywords.name: Listview Cell Text Should Not Be
keywords.shortdoc: Verifies that listview cell text is not ``expected``.

keywords.doc:
Verifies that any cell in the given listview row contains text expected.

See Double Click Listview Row By Index for details about arguments locator and row_index.
keywords.name: Listview Row At Index Should Contain
keywords.shortdoc: Verifies that any cell in the given listview row contains text ``expected``.

keywords.doc:
Verifies that any cell in the given listview row does not contain text expected.

See Double Click Listview Row By Index for details about arguments locator and row_index.
keywords.name: Listview Row At Index Should Not Contain
keywords.shortdoc: Verifies that any cell in the given listview row does not contain text ``expected``.

keywords.doc:
Verifies that the given listview row contains text expected.

See Double Click Listview Row for details about the arguments locator, column_name, and cell_text.
keywords.name: Listview Row Should Contain
keywords.shortdoc: Verifies that the given listview row contains text ``expected``.

keywords.doc:
Verifies that the given listview row does not contain text expected.

See Double Click Listview Row for details about the arguments locator, column_name, and cell_text.
keywords.name: Listview Row Should Not Contain
keywords.shortdoc: Verifies that the given listview row does not contain text ``expected``.

keywords.doc:
Maximizes a window.

locator is the locator of the window or a window object (optional).

If no locator value is given, the currently attached window is maximized. See Attach Window for details about attaching a window and window locator syntax.
keywords.name: Maximize Window
keywords.shortdoc: Maximizes a window.

keywords.doc:
Minimizes a window.

locator is the locator of the window or a window object (optional).

If no locator value is given, the currently attached window is minimized. See Attach Window for details about attaching a window and window locator syntax.
keywords.name: Minimize Window
keywords.shortdoc: Minimizes a window.

keywords.doc:
Clicks mouse at given position.

Position (x, y) is relative to application window top left. If no coordinates are given it uses current mouse position.
keywords.name: Mouse Click
keywords.shortdoc: Clicks mouse at given position.

keywords.doc:
Double clicks mouse at given position.

Position (x, y) is relative to application window top left. If no coordinates are given it uses current mouse position.
keywords.name: Mouse Double Click
keywords.shortdoc: Double clicks mouse at given position.

keywords.doc:
Presses left mouse button down at given position.

Position (x, y) is relative to application window top left. If no coordinates are given it uses current mouse position.
keywords.name: Mouse Left Button Down
keywords.shortdoc: Presses left mouse button down at given position.

keywords.doc:
Releases left mouse button up at given position.

Position (x, y) is relative to application window top left. If no coordinates are given it uses current mouse position.
keywords.name: Mouse Left Button Up
keywords.shortdoc: Releases left mouse button up at given position.

keywords.doc:
Right clicks mouse at given position.

Position (x, y) is relative to application window top left. If no coordinates are given it uses current mouse position.
keywords.name: Mouse Right Click
keywords.shortdoc: Right clicks mouse at given position.

keywords.doc:
Right double clicks mouse at given position.

Position (x, y) is relative to application window top left. If no coordinates are given it uses current mouse position.
keywords.name: Mouse Right Double Click
keywords.shortdoc: Right double clicks mouse at given position.

keywords.doc: Add (x, y) to current mouse location.
keywords.name: Move Mouse
keywords.shortdoc: Add (``x``, ``y``) to current mouse location.

keywords.doc:
Press a key or keys.

keys is the key or keys to press.

Example:

Press Keys a
Press Keys Text with special characters!
keywords.name: Press Keys
keywords.shortdoc: Press a key or keys.

keywords.doc:
Press a special key (Ctrl, tab, alt for example).

key must be one of the following: SHIFT, CONTROL, ALT, LEFT_ALT, RIGHT_ALT, RETURN ,RIGHT, BACKSPACE, LEFT, ESCAPE, TAB, HOME, END, UP, DOWN, INSERT, DELETE, CAPS, F1, F2, F3, F4, F5, F6, F7, F8, F9, F11, F12, F13, F14,F15, F16, F17, F18, F19, F20, F21, F22, F23,F24, PAGEUP, PAGEDOWN, PRINT, PRINTSCREEN, SPACE, NUMLOCK, SCROLL, LWIN, RWIN
keywords.name: Press Special Key
keywords.shortdoc: Press a special key (Ctrl, tab, alt for example).

keywords.doc:
Restores a window.

locator is the locator of the window or a window object (optional).

If no locator value is given, the currently attached window is restored. See Attach Window for details about attaching a window and window locator syntax.
keywords.name: Restore Window
keywords.shortdoc: Restores a window.

keywords.doc:
Right clicks an item.

locator is the locator of the item or object of an item. Locator syntax is explained in Item locators.

Optional arguments x_offset and y_offset can be used to define the coordinates to click at, relative to the center of the item.
keywords.name: Right Click Item
keywords.shortdoc: Right clicks an item.

keywords.doc:
Right clicks a listview cell using its column name and row index.

See Double Click Listview Cell for details about arguments locator, column_name, and row_index.
keywords.name: Right Click Listview Cell
keywords.shortdoc: Right clicks a listview cell using its column name and row index.

keywords.doc:
Right clicks a listview cell at index.

See Double Click Listview Cell By Index for details about arguments locator, row_index, and column_index.
keywords.name: Right Click Listview Cell By Index
keywords.shortdoc: Right clicks a listview cell at index.

keywords.doc:
Right clicks a listview row that has given text in given column.

See Double Click Listview Row for details about the arguments locator, column_name, and cell_text.
keywords.name: Right Click Listview Row
keywords.shortdoc: Right clicks a listview row that has given text in given column.

keywords.doc:
Right clicks a listview row at index.

See Double Click Listview Row By Index for details about arguments locator and row_index.
keywords.name: Right Click Listview Row By Index
keywords.shortdoc: Right clicks a listview row at index.

keywords.doc:
Right-clicks a tree node.

locator is the locator of the tree or Tree item object. Locator syntax is explained in Item locators.

node_path is the path the to node to right-click.

See examples of the node path in Select Tree Node documentation.
keywords.name: Right Click Tree Node
keywords.shortdoc: Right-clicks a tree node.

keywords.doc:
Selects a value from combobox by using its index.

locator is the locator of the combobox or ComboBox item object. Locator syntax is explained in Item locators.

item_index is the index to be selected.
keywords.name: Select Combobox Index
keywords.shortdoc: Selects a value from combobox by using its index.

keywords.doc:
Selects a value from a combobox.

locator is the locator of the combobox or ComboBox item object. Locator syntax is explained in Item locators.

value is the value to be selected.
keywords.name: Select Combobox Value
keywords.shortdoc: Selects a value from a combobox.

keywords.doc:
Selects an item by its index from a listbox.

locator is the locator of the listbox or ListBox item object. Locator syntax is explained in Item locators.

item_index is the index of the item to select.
keywords.name: Select Listbox Index
keywords.shortdoc: Selects an item by its index from a listbox.

keywords.doc:
Selects a value from a listbox.

locator is the locator of the listbox or ListBox item object. Locator syntax is explained in Item locators.

value is the value to be selected.
keywords.name: Select Listbox Value
keywords.shortdoc: Selects a value from a listbox.

keywords.doc:
Selects a listview cell.

See Double Click Listview Cell for details about arguments locator, column_name, and row_index.
keywords.name: Select Listview Cell
keywords.shortdoc: Selects a listview cell.

keywords.doc:
Selects a listview cell at index.

See Double Click Listview Cell By Index for details about arguments locator, row_index, and column_index.
keywords.name: Select Listview Cell By Index
keywords.shortdoc: Selects a listview cell at index.

keywords.doc:
Selects a listview row.

See Double Click Listview Row for details about the arguments locator, column_name, and cell_text.
keywords.name: Select Listview Row
keywords.shortdoc: Selects a listview row.

keywords.doc:
Selects a listview row at index.

See Double Click Listview Row By Index for details about arguments locator and row_index.
keywords.name: Select Listview Row By Index
keywords.shortdoc: Selects a listview row at index.

keywords.doc:
Attaches a modal window.

window_title is the title of the window.
keywords.name: Select Modal Window
keywords.shortdoc: Attaches a modal window.

keywords.doc:
Selects a radio button.

locator is the locator of the radio button or RadioButton item object. Locator syntax is explained in Item locators.
keywords.name: Select Radio Button
keywords.shortdoc: Selects a radio button.

keywords.doc:
Selects a tab page.

locator is the locator of the tab control item or Tab item object. Locator syntax is explained in Item locators.

title is the title of the tab page.
keywords.name: Select Tab Page
keywords.shortdoc: Selects a tab page.

keywords.doc:
Selects a tab page by index.

locator is the locator of the tab control item or Tab item object. Locator syntax is explained in Item locators.

index is integer index the tab page. Indexing starts from 0.
keywords.name: Select Tab Page By Index
keywords.shortdoc: Selects a tab page by index.

keywords.doc:
Selects a tree node.

locator is the locator of the tree or Tree item object. Locator syntax is explained in Item locators.

node_path is the path the to node to select.

Example tree (tree locator is tree_id):

root
|
|---parent_node
|   |
|   |---child_node
|   |
|   |---sibling_node
|
|---other parent

Example usage to select sibling node:

Select Tree Node tree_id root parent_node sibling_node
keywords.name: Select Tree Node
keywords.shortdoc: Selects a tree node.

keywords.doc:
Sets mouse position to (x, y).

Position is relative to application window top left.
keywords.name: Set Mouse Location
keywords.shortdoc: Sets mouse position to (``x``, ``y``).

keywords.doc:
Sets the directory where WhiteLibrary stores screenshots and returns the previously set path.

If the given directory does not exist in the system, it will be created when the first screenshot is taken.

path is the directory path.

The directory can also be set when the library is imported, see Importing for details.
keywords.name: Set Screenshot Directory
keywords.shortdoc: Sets the directory where WhiteLibrary stores screenshots and returns the previously set path.

keywords.doc:
Sets a slider to the specified value.

locator is the locator of the slider or Slider item object. Locator syntax is explained in Item locators.

value is the value to set.
keywords.name: Set Slider Value
keywords.shortdoc: Sets a slider to the specified value.

keywords.doc:
Sets BusyTimeout for White and returns original value.

timeout is the timeout value as Robot time string.

Default timeout is 5 seconds.
keywords.name: Set White Busy Timeout
keywords.shortdoc: Sets BusyTimeout for White and returns original value.

keywords.doc:
Sets DoubleClickInterval for White and returns original value.

DoubleClickInterval adds delay in double click action between clicks.

interval is the interval value as Robot time string.

Default interval is 0 milliseconds.
keywords.name: Set White Double Click Interval
keywords.shortdoc: Sets DoubleClickInterval for White and returns original value.

keywords.doc:
Sets DragStepCount for White.

value is the DragStepCount value as integer.

DragStepCount defines how many steps White uses to move dragged object to the destination. With default value 1 the dragged object is moved instantly in a single step from start to destination.
keywords.name: Set White Drag Step Count
keywords.shortdoc: Sets DragStepCount for White.

keywords.doc:
Sets FindWindowTimeout for White and returns original value.

timeout is the timeout value as Robot time string.

Default timeout is 30 seconds.
keywords.name: Set White Find Window Timeout
keywords.shortdoc: Sets FindWindowTimeout for White and returns original value.

keywords.doc:
Takes a screenshot of the whole desktop and inserts screenshot link to log file.

Returns path to the screenshot file.
keywords.name: Take Desktop Screenshot
keywords.shortdoc: Takes a screenshot of the whole desktop and inserts screenshot link to log file.

keywords.doc:
Disables or enables automatic screenshot capturing on failure.

status is the desired state (True/False) of automatic screenshot on failure. Boolean values are evaluated in the same way as the Robot Framework BuiltIn library does, see the documentation of BuiltIn for details.

WhiteLibrary automatically takes a screenshot on failure unless it is disabled with this keyword.
keywords.name: Take Screenshots On Failure
keywords.shortdoc: Disables or enables automatic screenshot capturing on failure.

keywords.doc:
Toggles a check box.

locator is the locator of the check box or CheckBox item object. Locator syntax is explained in Item locators.
keywords.name: Toggle Check Box
keywords.shortdoc: Toggles a check box.

keywords.doc:
DEPRECATED. Use Button Text Should Be or Button Text Should Contain instead.

Verifies text in a button.

locator is the locator of the button or Button item object.

expected is the expected button text.
keywords.name: Verify Button
keywords.shortdoc: *DEPRECATED.* Use `Button Text Should Be` or `Button Text Should Contain` instead.

keywords.doc:
Verifies state of a check box.

locator is the locator of the check box or CheckBox item object. Locator syntax is explained in Item locators.

expected is the expected state (True/False).
keywords.name: Verify Check Box
keywords.shortdoc: Verifies state of a check box.

keywords.doc:
DEPRECATED Please use Verify Combobox Selection instead.

Verifies the selected value of a combobox.

locator is the locator of the combobox or ComboBox item object. Locator syntax is explained in Item locators.

expected is the expected selection value.
keywords.name: Verify Combobox Item
keywords.shortdoc: *DEPRECATED* Please use Verify Combobox Selection instead.

keywords.doc:
Verifies that the combobox value is selected.

locator is the locator of the combobox or ComboBox item object. Locator syntax is explained in Item locators.

expected is the expected selection value.
keywords.name: Verify Combobox Selection
keywords.shortdoc: Verifies that the combobox value is selected.

keywords.doc:
Verifies text of a label.

locator is the locator of the label or Label item object. Locator syntax is explained in Item locators.

expected is the expected text.
keywords.name: Verify Label
keywords.shortdoc: Verifies text of a label.

keywords.doc:
Verifies the text of a menu item.

locator is the locator of the menu item or Menu item object. Locator syntax is explained in Item locators.

expected is the expected text of the menu item.
keywords.name: Verify Menu
keywords.shortdoc: Verifies the text of a menu item.

keywords.doc:
Verifies the value of a progress bar.

locator is the locator of the progress bar or ProgressBar item object. Locator syntax is explained in Item locators.

expected is the expected value of the progress bar.
keywords.name: Verify Progressbar Value
keywords.shortdoc: Verifies the value of a progress bar.

keywords.doc:
Verifies state of a radio button.

locator is the locator of the radio button or RadioButton item object. Locator syntax is explained in Item locators.

expected is the expected state (True/False).
keywords.name: Verify Radio Button
keywords.shortdoc: Verifies state of a radio button.

keywords.doc:
Verifies a slider value.

locator is the locator of the slider or Slider item object. Locator syntax is explained in Item locators.

expected is the expected value of the slider.
keywords.name: Verify Slider Value
keywords.shortdoc: Verifies a slider value.

keywords.doc:
Verifies text in a text box.

locator is the locator of the text box or Textbox item object. Locator syntax is explained in Item locators.

expected is the expected text of the text box.
keywords.name: Verify Text In Textbox
keywords.shortdoc: Verifies text in a text box.

keywords.doc:
Waits until no items with given locator exist in the attached window.

Fails if timeout is exceeded.

locator is the locator of the item. Locator syntax is explained in Item locators.

timeout is the maximum time to wait as a Robot time string.

See Waiting and timeouts for more information about waiting in WhiteLibrary.
keywords.name: Wait Until Item Does Not Exist
keywords.shortdoc: Waits until no items with given locator exist in the attached window.

keywords.doc:
Waits until an item with given locator exists in the attached window.

Fails if timeout is exceeded.

locator is the locator of the item. Locator syntax is explained in Item locators.

timeout is the maximum time to wait as a Robot time string.

See Waiting and timeouts for more information about waiting in WhiteLibrary.
keywords.name: Wait Until Item Exists
keywords.shortdoc: Waits until an item with given locator exists in the attached window.

keywords.doc:
Verifies that a window is maximized.

locator is the locator of the window or a window object (optional).

If no locator value is given, the status of the currently attached window is verified. See Attach Window for details about attaching a window and window locator syntax.
keywords.name: Window Should Be Maximized
keywords.shortdoc: Verifies that a window is maximized.

keywords.doc:
Verifies that a window is minimized.

locator is the locator of the window or a window object (optional).

If no locator value is given, the status of the currently attached window is verified. See Attach Window for details about attaching a window and window locator syntax.
keywords.name: Window Should Be Minimized
keywords.shortdoc: Verifies that a window is minimized.

keywords.doc:
Verifies that a window is restored.

locator is the locator of the window or a window object (optional).

If title is not given, currently attached window status is queried. See Attach Window for more details.
keywords.name: Window Should Be Restored
keywords.shortdoc: Verifies that a window is restored.

keywords.doc:
Verifies that the title of the currently attached window is expected.

Assumes that a window is attached. See Attach Window for details.
keywords.name: Window Title Should Be
keywords.shortdoc: Verifies that the title of the currently attached window is ``expected``.

keywords.doc:
Verifies that the title of the currently attached window contains text expected.

Assumes that a window is attached. See Attach Window for details.
keywords.name: Window Title Should Contain
keywords.shortdoc: Verifies that the title of the currently attached window contains text ``expected``.
